Name: Damascus
Description: The capital and largest city of Syria, known for its rich history, ancient monuments, and being one of the oldest continuously inhabited cities in the world.

Name: Aleppo
Description: A major city in northern Syria, historically significant for its culture, trade, and role in the medieval period.

Name: Homs
Description: A central Syrian city, historically known for its role in agriculture and industry, with significant ancient and modern landmarks.

Name: Latakia
Description: A coastal city and governorate in Syria, known for its beaches, resorts, and historical sites.

Name: Tartus
Description: A city on Syria s Mediterranean coast, known for its historical landmarks and port activities.

Name: Daraa
Description: A city in southern Syria, historically significant as the birthplace of the Syrian civil unrest in 2011.

Name: Raqqa
Description: A city in northern Syria, once an important historical and administrative center.

Name: Deir ez-Zor
Description: Located in eastern Syria, the city is known for its oil industry and strategic location along the Euphrates River.

Name: Hasakah
Description: A city in northeastern Syria, historically known for its agricultural production and diverse ethnic groups.

Name: Qamishli
Description: A city in northeastern Syria, home to a large Kurdish population and a center of trade.
